intro: Teucrium kraussii, commonly known as the Cape geranium, is a perennial shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. Teucrium kraussii is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
